Description and Approximate timeline tha: Based on the aerial photos, the areas surrounding the former buildings located on Site are covered with asphalt parking.

Based on the FIPs, the Site appears to be developed with two (2) commercial buildings: the main building was reported occupied by used car sales companies; the other building was occupied by a repair garage. An unused oil tank was reportedly located in the basement of the main building. Based on the chain of title, the Site was developed with an auto garage between 1956 and 1971. Based on the city directory, the Site was occupied by North York Garage Auto Repair (1960–1985/86), Post Load Auto Centre (1989), I A Ansa International Rent a Car, Affordable Auto Leasing Ltd and Wholesale Auto Centre Inc (1995), Downsview Car Centre and First Choice Rent-A-Car (2001). Based on the Site representative, one (1) UST was removed during demolition in 2018.

Potentially Contaminating Activity (PCA): #28 – Gasoline and Associated Products Storage in Fixed Tanks

Potentially Contaminating Activity (PCA): #30 – Importation of Fill Material of Unknown Quality
Description and Approximate timeline tha: Based on the aerial photos, the former buildings at the Site were demolished in 2018 and fill material may have been imported to the Site.

Potentially Contaminating Activity (PCA): #52 – Storage, Maintenance, Fuelling and Repair of Equipment, Vehicles, and Material Used to Maintain Transportation Systems
Description and Approximate timeline tha: Based on the ERIS report, the property located at 1035 Sheppard Avenue West, approximately 80 m south, occupied by Toronto Transit Commission, was listed as a waste generator of inert inorganic wastes, oil skimmings and sludges, paint/pigment/coating residues, acid waste – heavy metals, petroleum distillates, alkaline wastes – other metals, aliphatic solvents, detergents/soaps between 1995 and 2018. The property was listed as having operation of urban transit system. Based on the aerial photos, the property appears to be constructed with Sheppard West subway station.
Based on the ERIS report, the property located at 1011 Sheppard Avenue West, approximately 160 m east, had three (3) records of approximately 200 kg of in-use light ballasts between 1994 and 1996.
Based on the ERIS report, the building located at 20 Tillplain Road, approximately 250 m northeast, had three (3) records of approximately 878 L of transformer between 1995 and 1996.
Contribution to APEC at the Site: No; Located at a significant distance
